publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3355 Ross Finnie: Support Barony Chambers Restoration—That the Parliament supports East Dunbartonshire Council’s grant funding application to Historic Scotland to help with the restoration of Barony Chambers in Kirkintilloch, built in 1814-15 and which has served as a town hall, council chambers, courthouse, school and jail, being a grade B building of special architectural and historic interest and arguably one of the most important historic monuments in Kirkintilloch.
S3M-3355 Support Barony Chambers Restoration (lodged on 2 February 2009) Jackson Carlaw*, Jamie Stone*, David Whitton*, Jackie Baillie*, Stuart McMillan*
S3M-3355 Support Barony Chambers Restoration (lodged on 2 February 2009) Des McNulty*, Bill Wilson*, Bill Kidd*, Jim Tolson*, Hugh O’Donnell*
S3M-3355 Support Barony Chambers Restoration (lodged on 2 February 2009) Gil Paterson*

S3M-3355 Ross Finnie: Support Barony Chambers Restoration—That the Parliament supports East Dunbartonshire Council’s grant funding application to Historic Scotland to help with the restoration of Barony Chambers in Kirkintilloch, built in 1814-15 and which has served as a town hall, council chambers, courthouse, school and jail, being a grade B building of special architectural and historic interest and arguably one of the most important historic monuments in Kirkintilloch. Supported by: Jackson Carlaw, Jamie Stone, David Whitton, Jackie Baillie, Stuart McMillan, Des McNulty, Bill Wilson, Bill Kidd, Jim Tolson, Hugh O’Donnell, Gil Paterson
